data.title: Scott Disick 'sends warning' to Travis Barker over PDA sessions with ex Kourtney
data.meta_description: Scott Disick is unhappy with his ex Kourtney Kardashian over her excessive PDA sessions  with husband Travis Barker in front of their kids.
data.text:
Scott Disick is unhappy with Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker's public displays of affection around their children.

Scott and Kourtney, who starred on Keeping Up with the Kardashians, dated on and off for about 10 years before splitting up, with the relationship producing three children - Mason, 14, Penelope, 11, and Reign, 9.

Kourtney married the Blink-182 drummer, Travis Barker, in May 2022 and they welcomed a son, Rocky Thirteen, in November 2023.

"Scott takes being a dad seriously and wants what's best for the kids," a source told OK! Magazine.

"He's put his foot down on more and more issues lately — including asking Kourtney to tone down the PDA with Travis in front of their children."

READ MORE: What is Kourtney Kardashian’s net worth? Poosh empire and reality TV income

A recent TikTok video showed Kourtney and Travis kissing while Penelope stood nearby, prompting comments like "Poor P just hovering around while they exchange spit."

This comes after an insider said Scott and Kourtney were "at war" over their children's best interests.

"They adore Kourtney's husband, Travis, especially their son, Mason," the insider said.

"Scott is scared of being replaced, and as you can see, it's really taking a toll on him."

DONT MISS...

Kardashians' biggest business flops - from prepaid debit card to perfume brand with ex [insight]

Kourtney Kardashian's incredible style transformation from girly gowns to grunge rockstar [pictures]

Last year, another source claimed Scott was "focusing on himself and his kids" as Kourtney prepared to have Travis' baby.

"Scott tries to be as supportive of Kourtney as possible, but also knows that it's best to keep his distance, especially during a stressful time," the source said.

"Scott and Kourtney are not as friendly as they used to be, so he tries to be respectful and give her space, while also being there for her and the family."
